item.title: Fancy dress back in fashion in London
item.description: Organizers say fancy dress has not been banned at the 2016 London Sevens -- but there are new restrictions on alcohol never before seen at a major event at Twickenham.
item.ExtractedText: 1 of 13 13 photos: Rugby fans warned: Wear what you want - but behave There had been reports fancy dress could be banned for this year by the Rugby Football Union in a bid to curb anti-social behavior by spectators. Hide Caption 2 of 13 13 photos: Rugby fans warned: Wear what you want - but behave But these Star Trek wannabes can dress up again this weekend, although the RFU is not pushing a fancy dress theme as it has done in the past. Hide Caption 3 of 13 13 photos: Rugby fans warned: Wear what you want - but behave Instead, organizers have been working with locals in a bid to cut down on the level of drinking by spectators. Hide Caption 4 of 13 13 photos: Rugby fans warned: Wear what you want - but behave This year's theme is focused on food and families, and also local residents attending the event. Hide Caption 5 of 13 13 photos: Rugby fans warned: Wear what you want - but behave The Honey Monster was on hand 12 months ago to watch as the United States came away as surprise winner of the tournament. Hide Caption 13 photos: Rugby fans warned: Wear what you want - but behave In 2009, this set of Albert Einstein lookalikes partied at Twickenham. Hide Caption 7 of 13 13 photos: Rugby fans warned: Wear what you want - but behave With the stadium located in the flight path for Heathrow Airport, the air crew theme has proved popular. Hide Caption 13 photos: Rugby fans warned: Wear what you want - but behave Face-painting is also a common motif for fans. Hide Caption 9 of 13 13 photos: Rugby fans warned: Wear what you want - but behave Last year, one fan dressed as the gas cooker from the Wallace and Gromit movie "A Grand Day Out." Hide Caption 13 photos: Rugby fans warned: Wear what you want - but behave Trekkies tend to be in attendance, as evidenced a year ago in the English capital. Hide Caption 13 photos: Rugby fans warned: Wear what you want - but behave Cartoon characters such as Scooby-Doo are also popular. Hide Caption
